qas.question: What direction has Europe moved towards?
What caused the spread of secularism?
What areas have a higher rate of Christian observance?

answers.text: North America, South America and Australia

qas.question: What country is more religious than other developed nations?
When did South America show an increase in Evangelicals?

context: In Europe, there has been a general move away from religious observance and belief in Christian teachings and a move towards <a0_0>secularism<a0_0/>. <a1_0>The Enlightenment<a1_0/> is largely responsible for the spread of secularism. Several scholars have argued for a link between the rise of secularism and Protestantism, attributing it to the wide-ranging freedom in the Protestant countries. In <a2_0>North America, South America and Australia<a2_0/> Christian religious observance is much higher than in Europe. <a3_0>United States<a3_0/> remains particularly religious in comparison to other developed countries. South America, historically Roman Catholic, has experienced a large Evangelical and Pentecostal infusion in <a4_0>the 20th and 21st centuries<a4_0/>.
